p: Rescue medication with 2 doses of IVIg 2.0 g/kg given 3 weeks apart may be administered to the patients in the IVIg 0.5 and 1.0 g/kg groups if they have: (1) deterioration of CIDP (defined as an increase in adjusted INCAT disability score of ≥1 point) after week 3 and before week 18; or (2) no improvement in CIDP (defined as an unchanged adjusted INCAT disability score) at week 6. After administration of rescue medication, these patients discontinue study treatment and attend an end‐of‐study assessment visit at 3 weeks after the second rescue dose. Patients in the IVIg 2.0 g/kg group with deterioration of CIDP after week 3 and before week 18 or no improvement at week 6 will also discontinue study treatment.
